highlighted_projects.description: Created an application that takes a users input of latitude and longitude and displays the google earth image at that location. Project used APi, Java, Android emulators, and HTML.
highlighted_projects.name: Android application for finding google earth images

jarvis_projects.description: Developed a tool that grabs computers hardware and usage information and sends the information to a database. This tool is implemented on a cluster system to get details of the efficiency of each node in the cluster. The project uses Java, crontabs, bash, scripts, and postgresql.
jarvis_projects.name: Linux Cluster Resource Monitoring App

name: Karen Lauzon

professional_experience.description: Develops projects using java, Linux, Bash, Databases, SQL, and Git. The requirements and purpose of the projects are defined by the client needs and a solution is formed, developed, and implemented.

professional_experience.description: Utilized tools and basic troubleshooting skills to assist clients in problem solving their software and hardware issues remotely. Explained solutions to clients in non technical, easy to follow instructions.

summary: I was a computer Programming student at Algonquin College, we learned a wide spread of basic computer knowledge as well as studied the more common programming languages and completed many projects using these skills. I enjoy all things computer and technology-related, however, I have not had much experience in a professional environment. I have taken optional courses in programming and computer science since I was in high school where I put my problem-solving abilities to use building computer games. I started at Carleton University before realizing that the courses that captured my attention were computer-based ones, and I have been looking to improve my skills in the field ever since.
